sub-events.comment: set size of tilemap array to that of the tilemap
set a tile in a certain XY
make the dictionary with the tile mappings
any with other rules (you can also omit certain tile types from the test

Basically, it goes through and adds up a string like 1011 and then searches for it in the dictionary to see if it has that tile mapped. If it does, it sets that tile. This way you can program tiles to be a certain way based on their surroundings.
It's also less CPU intensive to use a dictionary than a thousand if statements
if tile above, add a 1 to the current string
only if has key made from all the 10001011 stuff
otherwise if it isn't a certain tile, delete it
load tiles from tilmap to the array (not used)
clear and get ready prefab list
add a prefab cave / ore deposit
add a list of prefabs from text
Destroy a tile with item drop

variable.comment: what type of block was destroyed
variable.name: type

sub-events.comment: Overwrite all strength values with defaults for certain block
Overwrite a tile's strength value with default for that block
Reset if over 50% of strength is retained
If it is too damaged, destroy it

condition.name: Compare two values
condition.param: floor(Mouse.X / tileMapSize) - loopindex("X") + floor(Mouse.Y / tileMapSize) - loopindex("Y")
